replies.body:
You uh

You know how much it costs to do that, right.

You call yourself a "true gamer", but you have no idea what causes loading delays.

It has _nothing_ to do with the speed of the computer.

Drive read speed and network speed are the causes, and the former can only be increased by switching to a SSD. The latter cannot be increased at all for most users.

> [{quoted}](name=FailedAbortion,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=MzlsHUt2,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-03-24T05:31:39.657+0000)
>
> RAM disk is pretty cool.

Next to nobody has touched a ramdisk in over 20 years unless it was out of boredom, SSDs made them totally irrelevant, and even before that it was questionable gains.

Absolutely useless for a game, since it gets loaded off the disk one way or another, and loading a 10GB game instead of maybe half a GB of specific files is absurd. Not to mention it requires 16GB of RAM or more.

Wow. Why are you lying?

RAM disk is much faster than SSD.
The amount of RAM required depends on what you load into the RAM disk. I have used RAM disks as small as 500MB before.

> [{quoted}](name=FailedAbortion,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=MzlsHUt2,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-25T01:05:51.993+0000)
>
> Wow. Why are you lying?
> 
> RAM disk is much faster than SSD.
> The amount of RAM required depends on what you load into the RAM disk. I have used RAM disks as small as 500MB before.

The different is utterly negligible and in fact unmeasurable for most software, just like the difference between a SATA6 and NVMe M.2 SSD.

And for LoL, the minimum size would be about 12GB, leaving 4GB for the OS and client on a 16GB system, which would likely hurt performance more than it helped.

Also outright impossible on the systems that would benefit from it, most 16GB gaming systems will have SSDs anyway.

Again with the lying?

There are plenty of benchmarks for you to compare SSD vs RAM. If you want to claim the difference is unrecognizable to humans, that would be different. I would still say you are wrong.

Your numbers are bull shit. My entire Riot games folder is 11.2 GB. You don't even need to load the entire folder into the RAM disk. Besides, my OS is using 1.6 GB of RAM. I could load the entire folder into RAM and still have plenty of room for my OS to function.

You don't need 16 GB of RAM to use a RAM disk. It is completely dependent on how much you want to load into the RAM disk. Once again, I have used RAM disks as small as 500 MB.

I feel like a person well versed in games and the communities that make up those games would realize that not everyone can or want to upgrade their computer just to play one game.

>you're wasting money on various things you don't need

A lot of people would argue that a gaming computer easily falls in that category. And that's coming from a person with a decent computer.

Upgrading a pc= expensive. And as adults, we have bills to pay, children or wives possibly, and lifes to live. Sometimes we can't afford to buy brand new computers.

Go out, work, pay bills and then come back and say the same shit. Unless you're getting a free ride at your parents house, or your just a kid.
